column4: If I do the 'cp' command and the files/folders already exist will it just overwrite them all?
you can use cp -i ... to have cp ask you for overwriting
But if i dont do the -i what will it do as default?
Is there any way to only make it overwrite the files that are different and have been changed?
there is no -u on the man page for cp
i just checked, there really is
maybe you have translated manpage, not the original english?
I cant see a u on my screen, only an f
im using osx atm though not ubuntu
then you are in the wrong channel
if osx's cp does not have -u option, maybe you want to use rsync instead
